DOC.detailed_description: Objective : Technology show promise enhance standard care diabetes cost-effective , online lifestyle intervention . Compared Primary Care ( PC ) Diabetes System Care ( control ) , investigator hypothesize Technology Intervention Diabetes Engagement & Self-Care ( TIDES ) would significantly improve diabetes knowledge self-care . Methods : Following Institutional Review Board ( IRB ) approval , physician letter send patient type 2 diabetes , age > 18 year HgA1c > 8 % identify via Electronic Health Record ( EHR ) integrate US health system invite participation 3-site , 24-week diabetes study . Of 270 > 1 week email/web use invite share medical visit ( SMV ) orientation , 166 subject provide write informed consent . Diabetes knowledge self-care assessment , vital sign , HgA1c , fast glucose lipid collect baseline , 3 6 month . Following randomization TIDES ( N=117 ) usual care ( N=49 ) , TIDES group orient multimedia online intervention include dose sequence learn via email , video , slide show , food solution , expert question answer , quiz .
